snippet: In response to rumors of a coup that spread online, China detained six people, closed 16 Web sites and silenced comments on two widely used microblogs.
abstract: China cracks down on its vibrant social networking media, detaining six people, closing 16 Web sites and shutting off the comment function for two gigantic microblog services; campaign is directly linked to the political instability that has gripped China since one of its most charismatic politicians, Bo Xilai, lost his post in March, spurring rumors of a coup, which the government-run Xinhua news agency cited as the reason for the measures.
lead_paragraph: In response to rumors of a coup that spread online, China detained six people, closed 16 Web sites and silenced comments on two widely used microblogs.

headline.seo: China Clamps Down on Social Networking Over Online Rumors
headline.main: Coup Rumors Spur China to Hem in Social Networking Sites
headline.print_headline: China Limits Online Discussion Over Rumors

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
